Hi

What these people do not talk about is the "cost". In the long term the costs eat away 15-20% of your Porfolio's CAGR. For instance, in the long-term if the portfolio's CAGR is 40%, your net CAGR will be only 20% after incorporating the costs. You can see this exemplified under "Cost-adjusted Returns" on your Smallcase dashboard. The keywords here are "in the long term".

What are the costs? Every smallcase SIP is charged. Every smallcase lumpsum investment is charged. You pay for the subscription. You pay hefty DP charges when you sell the stocks (at the time of Rebalancing). You pay STT, brokerage, Exchange charges, SEBI charges, Stamp Duty, GST (at the time of Rebalancing or SIP or lumpsum investment). These are nowhere shown or accounted in the portfolio. Just remember the costs will eat away 15-20% off your CAGR. Enjoy!
